  545. I love this mirror. The instructions that another reviewer gave about holding down the on switch until the lights flicker was right on.<br /><br />My only real problem with the mirror is that if there is any backlight at all, you get shadows on the mirror. The the glare of the lights while the mirror is reflecting the shadows makes it hard to see. If I didn't have backlighting it would be perfect. As it is, I don't think any other mirror would do better. And this was a great price.<br /><br />You should note also that the plastic stand is a little flimsy. It doesn't lock into position, just kind of rests there. So if you have animals or kids that are likely to bump it, store it flat, so that it doesn't slam down and break.<br /><br />All in all, I'm very pleased.
  546. Bought this mirror, love it! If you're looking to replace the Conair True Reflections II, this is the model you want. My mom passed her used Conair down to me when my dad gave her a new one...I'd had it for years when one of the doors broke and couldn't be fixed...I lived with it this way for many more years and finally decided I'd buy a new one for myself for my birthday. WHAT!!?? They don't make that Conair any more??? UGH! After some searching I found this one (hated the round models, hated the incandescent models), read lots of reviews, struggled with the idea of ordering this one sight unseen and shipping mirrors through the mail--EGADS!--what if the mirror broke in transit, then I'd have to send it back, etc... Can I tell you how much I LOVE THIS MIRROR?! It has slightly more magnification than the Conair model but it's all the better to see you with my dear! And the mirror pivots on the horizontal rather than vertical so it can be adjusted either by using the \\"kick stand\\" in the back or by adjusting the vertical tilt. And the manufacturer has added a little sticker over the on/off switch for those who have no understanding/patience for florescent bulbs (see, I did read the reviews) but, if you recall, you had to hold down the on switch for the Conair as well. Excellent price, Excellent product. It's been a long time since I've been this satisfied with a mirror. LOL, hope this helps you make your decision!

  558. This is a great mirror - different settings, can close the mirror when not using, lights are bright and there's an extra outlet to plug a blow dryer or curling iron into.<br /><br />But then the light bulbs go out and it's almost impossible to replace. My husband, who is a mechanic by trade, cannot pry open the plastic casing. The plastic screens come off where the bulbs are but it's impossible to get the bulbs out. I have searched online and cannot find anything other than prying the mirror apart.<br /><br />So I give it one star because when the bulbs go, so does the mirror.<br /><br />If anyone has an idea how to fix this, feel free to comment.<br /><br />Update - my husband, the genius, figured it out (is he a genius for figuring out how to get the bulbs out? I think so). On the 4 corners of the back are plastic clips - sort of like little round covers - that cover the screws to open the mirror to change the bulbs.<br /><br />WHEH! It's sort of obvious, my husband keeps saying he should have known. Well, it's a learning experience.<br /><br />I still give it 3 stars because of this. I wound up getting a new mirror.

  618. This is your standard, run of the mill old-school makeup mirror. Not modern and stylish, but it *works*.<br />Nothing on the shelf these days has any brightness to the bulbs. Unless you're in a well lit room to start with, they're pretty much useless. But these old-school mirrors are a million times brighter. You can see any clogged pore or stray hair. And you can see to blend out your makeup so you look airbrushed.<br />These mirrors are big and heavy and clunky so taking them on vaca is a chore, but if your hotel lighting is wonky, it could be the difference between looking great and having people stare at your bad makeup job.<br />I've tried all kinds of travel mirrors and even super expensive lighted mirrors but always come back to these.<br />This seller too is beyond fast!   636. This thing is great! Nice and bright, affordable, and I love the light changing feature. I have horrible lighting in my house, and I can see my face clearly with this.
  637. Shipped on time and a great product. Love this mirror, i had one for over 20 years and it got broke, so i had to replace it.
  638. I bought this as a solution to living with several roommates and one bathroom. I turned my desk into pseudo-vanity. This is exactly what I wanted! The different light settings are great for indoor use, the mirrors can be easily tilted to where I need them to be, and there's an outlet on the bottom right that is great for my curling or straightening iron! It's pretty to look at and folds up nicely. When I'm not using this, I fold it up and lay it down - it draws no extra attention to itself. I have a lot of precision and clarity when applying makeup. It's just a great product.
  639. Helps me a lot in the morning or when I'm going out, easier to see what I'm doing without standing up in the bathroom
  640. I ordered this mirror because I already had what I thought was the SAME exact mirror. However, this particular mirror has a major distortion problem on the magnification side. I don't know if the manufacturer made changes to this model or if this is a defect.<br /><br />None of my other similar mirrors have this distortion problem. I feel like I wasted the money I spent on this mirror.
  641. This mirror is just what I was looking for. I like that you can move the larger mirror itself to an adjustment that suits you without having to adjust the entire mirror using the stand. The magnifying mirror is very good at enlarging your image. The cord is a little longer then the Conair brand which is a big plus.<br />There are a couple of things that I do not like though. The stand has no way of staying in place when you put it up to make it easier to store. The Conair brand had small hooks in the plastic frame that lets you snap the stand in place when you want to place it in a cabinet between uses. Therefore when you want to store it, you have to wrap the cord around it so that both the metal and the plastic stands stay up.<br />I wish the companies that make these products would take all these options into consideration when the make the items. It would make it more usable to the purchaser and salable to the company.
  642. Works perfectly and is exactly what I needed with both a regular and magnifying mirror. Item was in good condition, packaged very securely. It arrived on time too!
  643. I bought this to replace my old makeup mirror which does still work, but is about 23 years old. I don't think it's actually true to light like my old one is, but it's still very nice. The side mirrors are nice to have but not enough of a bonus to make up for the other issues. I also do not like that I cannot have it vertical at all. It has to be at a fairly steep angle to stay upright.   655. I am very nearsighted but can't tweeze with my glasses on, and have had to wait for a nice sunny day, with the sun coming through the window at just the right angle and the mirror at just the right angle to tweeze what have become coarse, grey hair that now grows on my neck and chin (used to be black, so I guess grey is an improvement). This mirror not only allows me to see whatever needs plucking any time, day or night, but also has a 120V plug-in on the front so I can style my hair sitting right at my table. I'm really pleased - wish I'd had it 15 years ago. Much more and better light than the old Clairol lighted makeup mirror.
  656. So wanted to like this item. The lighting was great and by far the brightest I have found. The first one of these I ordered arrived and straight out of the box I had a problem. The sliding mechanism that changes the light color was stuck. After about thirty minutes of trying to figure out what was wrong, it suddenly started sliding, but the light color panels were a little off and not correctly aligned giving me a light that was mixed between settings. But because because I was so happy with the brightness of the light I ordered another. Out of the box it was working great and I was very happy with it. One month and one week later, the bulbs start flickering then go out, but when I turn it off then turn it on they work for awhile then start flickering and go out again. One impaired product I can handle, it happens. Two impaired products within a month of each other, it becomes a questionable product.
  657. I purchased this in 2009, yes, five years ago. I intended to wait long enough to write a review, due to all of the mixed reviews, but then forgot about it until now.   659. This mirror size is great. The mirror stand seems a little big flimsy but works well.<br /><br />One big downfall for me is the light the mirror emits. It has four different light settings (daytime, evening, home and office environments) which really do not resemble any of those environments. I wish it had just one really good light. I use my desk lamp as a substitute. I know that many have complained about the lighting system but if you are looking for a good mirror and don't care about the lights (like me) this mirror is great.
  660. In spite of the &#34;YES&#34; answer posted on the front page of this item, you cannot change the bulb yourself. You SHOULD be able to... they are just simple florescent bulbs, but you need some special tool to remove the housing. Instead you are instructed to mail the item to Richardson with a check for $15 to replace the bulb. What a hassle. I LIKED this mirror while it worked (about 2 years for me), hence the second star. But to not be able to perform a simple light bulb change means this is going in the trash, and I'll buy a different brand.

If it wasn't for that I would totally give 5 stars because this is really a nice mirror.   727. UPDATE: I originally gave this one star, but that seems unfair- I had received an already-used-and-returned product. Not sure how that happened, but... we're all human- someone obviously made a mistake. The mirror I received today works great- the switch has no kinks in it; you just turn it on, and it lights up. Maybe it's a newer model? The 5xMagnification mirror is quite magnified; I move a certain distance from it to get my face into focus. I really like this mirror, actually. I couldn't find anything like it in the several department stores I checked. Previously, I bought some other mirror instead (since that's all they had at Target), and I hated it. This is more like the old one I used to have.<br /><br />ORIGINAL POST: I was so excited. Until I plugged the thing in. Nothing. No lights. I'd seen the review, \\"hold the on button down for 5 seconds\\". I held it down for a WHILE. Nothing. (I tried many different plugs, holding my mouth different each time- still nothing.)<br />I went to pack it back up for return, which is when I noticed the Jerdon box it came in had been taped together at the corner. So the box had already been damaged.<br />Then I went to put the packing slip return notice on the box, and noticed a small piece of Christmas wrapping paper still taped to the edge!<br />OK, so... if someone returns something that didn't work, it should go in the \\"does-not-work\\" pile, so that the next customer doesn't get it by mistake. Yes?<br />Maybe these things aren't tested before being sent. Maybe this was just a fluke.<br />PS Five minutes later, I'm upping my rating to 4 stars. Jerdon's customer service got back to me quite quickly through email (not the phone number, which didn't work). They sound very apologetic, and are maybe sending me a new mirror. If it works, I'll bump the stars up to 5 stars and count my initial problem as an aberration.

  777. This is an excellent mirror, however it has a few design flaws. First, the collapsible stand is very flimsy. I have had near misses of the mirror tipping over. If you are going to keep it in the same place and hardly ever move it, then it should be fine. But I wish the back of the mirror was sturdier.<br /><br />Additionally, there isn't any casing in the back. In order to close the wings to keep the mirror dust free, you need to flip the mirror so that the normal side (as opposed to the magnifying side) is upwards. But because there is no casing in the back, that leaves the magnified side exposed. Again, this isn't an issue if you keep this in the same place constantly. But if you're moving around or need to pack the mirror for travel, it isn't the sturdiest protection.<br /><br />And finally, I feel it could be a bit bigger. I don't mind sacrificing compactness for better mirror coverage. While the side wing mirrors get my face OK, I would like them to be bigger so I can also see my hair. What is the point of having a mirror only for makeup? Most women want to do their makeup and their hair in the same spot. It's not as if the current size is all that compact so they might as well make it bigger and sturdier.<br /><br />Besides these flaws, I think this is a good product because the lighting is sufficient and the mirrors are good quality.

I also really appreciate the warranty that comes with it. The lights are guaranteed to function for life, but if they don't for whatever reason you just ship it back to the manufacturer and they replace the lights for free. All in all, this was a great buy for an even better price.

  862. This is a good quality mirror. It has the features one would expect, for a price perhaps lower than what you would expect to pay. The mirror rotates from standard to 5x magnification, and it has side mirrors which can be angled for profiling. It has four distinct lighting options, \\"Day, Office, Evening, and Home\\". It also includes a handy receptacle in the front for accessories such as hair rollers, blow dryers, flat irons, etc.<br /><br />The quality seems to be good. Overall this is a nice product, and if you are in need of a cosmetic mirror, it is recommended without reservation.

  872. I am an avid reader of reviews before I buy products from any website especially Amazon. They are usually informative and helpful. That being said after reading reviews for this product I decided to purchase it. This was a christmas gift for my girlfriend so I expected it to work. It didn't. The lights wouldn't turn on at all. I was quite surprised so I went back and started reading reviews again. I noticed by default Amazon pulls up \\"the most helpful\\" reviews...not the newest. When sorting by the \\"newest\\" reviews first I found out I'm not the only one that received a faulty unit. Apparently the quality has really went down hill so my suggestion to you is when purchasing any product from Amazon make sure to read the newest reviews first. A great review from 5 years ago doesnt necessarily translate into a good product today. Shame on you Amazon.

Before I purchased this mirror, I read many other reviews and decided to check it for myself, as my old Remington mirror (which is no longer made)died out and I was desperate for something new. Well....here's the honest truth of the good and the bad.<br /><br />Good...the regular mirror is perfect and it's nice to have some side view mirrors as well. Bad... the flip side of the mirror that gives you a 5x magnifier makes you feel like you are at an amusement park looking at yourself in a mirror with a distorted view. Although I would sometimes use that on my old model, I could live without it.<br /><br />Good...the \\"day\\" light choice was the same as my old model and provides me with just the right light. Bad... there is a lever to slide which moves colored plastic over the lights to give you other types of low lighting, but it's stuck and won't move past the day light. I could have returned it but didn't want to wait for a new one since I never used other shades of lighting on my make up mirror and only used the day light.<br /><br />I read that others were frustrated when you turn the lights on that they shut off. That's because of the kind of bulbs they are. You have to hold down the \\"on\\" switch long enuf for them to light up. So...<br /><br />The good is that they do work. The bad is, (which is not so bad)is the slight humming noise, again because I believe they are a florescent (sp) light. I fixed that by putting a soft pad underneath the mirror it to absorb the sound. I don't really even hear it now.<br /><br />With all that, you'd think I'd rate it less than 4 stars... but all in all I'm happy with my purchase.

  980. I wanted to have a good mirror to apply my makeup in the morning, and after seeing this, with its stand, multi-setting lighting, and plug outlet, I was sold. I just got it yesterday and I am already in love! It's great and works so well. It came really fast too. All around happy with it :-)
  981. What more can I say...the wife loves it. It gives her the right illumination for putting on the correct blend of makeup for morning or evening wear.   984. Bottom support kept popping off. If it isn't on the unit, then you have to prop the mirror against something as it won't stand by itself. Lights were not bright enough for me to see myself.   1028. My wife purchased a Jerdon JGL9W to replace her 20 year old Clairol \\"True To Light\\" makeup mirror which had worn-out hinges. The Jerdon worked fine at first, then the lights began to flicker, and finally quit altogether. I was extremely disappointed to see the \\"do not open - no user serviceable parts inside\\" notation on the case - in my opinion, this statement is a scam by manufacturers to force replacement of repairable products. I finally discovered that the four phillips screws that hold the case together are concealed by small round plastic covers on the back side. Carefully drill or punch a hole in each cover and they pop out. There is no need to replace them. The bulbs use slide-on terminals rather than sockets, and are held in place with fiber retainers, which have to be released from plastic tabs. It turned out that the bulbs are OK in my wife's unit, but the ballast is open and the switch works poorly. I saw in another post that the manufacturer is replacing these units, so we will try that route, but will never again buy a product from a manufacturer that tries to make bulb replacement impossible in an illuminated product!!<br /><br />David<br /><br />FOLLOW-UP: Jerdon promptly replaced the make-up mirror, and the replacement is still working. However, the new unit has the same issue with bulbs - the manufacturer has made it nearly impossible for the owner to replace them. Why??
  1029. I love the 3 mirrors, great for styling my hair. Takes a while to get used to the different colors of lighting for makeup application.
  1030. Returned because it didn't magnify correctly it was distorted.
  1031. I bought this product because there were alot of reviews online saying it was the closest thing to the Clairol &#34;True to Light&#34; make-up mirrors from the '80's and '90's. I found that, at least on the daylight setting which is supposed to emulate bright dayight, that in fact it is NOT as clear and bright a light as the Clairol mirrors used to be. I think it has something to do with the color filters that change with the different light settings. When set for the brightest setting, part of the colored filter is still facing forward for the other settings and it dims the daytime setting somewhat. It is hard to believe that no other manufacturer has been able to replicate the Clairol mirrors as, from what I read on the Internet, there is still a big demand for something comparable.

  1070. I use the Jerdon trifold mirror to apply makeup or for any close up detail work that needs my attention.<br />Jerdon has the best true image and magnification of any mirror I've owned and I have owned three Jerdon Classics over the last 30 years - I always come back for more when one is needed.   1071. I really like this tri-fold mirror, and was very unhappy when, after a little more than 1 year, the lights burned out. And even unhappier when I learned that I would have to send this to the manufacturer for them to replace the lights. Really? No, I don't believe I will do that. I was hopeful that by holding the on button down for 10 seconds as suggested by another reviewer would work, but the light is definitely burned out. I was not pleased with the selection of lighted make-up mirrors at Bed, Bath, and Beyond, which is where I originally purchased this mirror. So, I figured this was useless without the lights anyway, I may as well open it up to see if I could replace the lights. On the back of the mirror case, there are 4 indentations that cover the screws, and once you pop them out, the screw heads are visible. Unscrew with a philip's head driver, but be careful when you take the back off to prevent damaging the light filter. I never used the variable lighting, only the \\"day\\" setting, so I just removed the rotating lenses to access the tube. The tubes are easily removed by pulling the copper connections off. The florescent tube replacement is F6T5/CW (CW is for cool white, brighter than soft white). I paid $6.19 for each tube. Plug in the tubes, close the unit, and screw it together, and voila! You have a great make-up mirror.
  1072. I did a lot of research before buying this mirror and decided to go with this one because of the ratings and price. I was scared that some people had problems with the bulbs but we have had this one a year now, and my 15 year old uses every single day so it has held up wonderfully, very good product and purchase!

  1094. Listen to the negative reviews and don't purchase this mirror. I want to replace a very old and beaten-up Remington mirror that is terrible looking but still works like a champ (but isn't made anymore, sadly), so I ordered this mirror hoping I would side with the positive reviews. I only had to plug it in once to see that it doesn't emit half the light of the one I am replacing, and the magnifying mirror is unclear and distorted compared to the Remington. I am over 50 and my vision is getting a lot worse, and this mirror does nothing to help me see my face more clearly; there are only disadvantages to its use. It appears cheaply made and there's no way to hang it on the wall, either. Terribly disappointed, and frustrated too. This mirror is being returned! It was manufactured to resemble my old one, but is nothing but a cheap imitation.
  1095. All in all I like the product. It works well for what I need. The light is not as bright as I think I would like it to be.. But keeping it on the day setting dose the trick. Worth the money. Shipped fast and came in great shape. Thank you Amazon!
  1096. The magnified mirror is really warbled. You pretty much have to get right up next to it for it to become clear enough to use. Also, my light switch doesn't move. It is stuck on the middle setting & won't budge. Since this lighting is adequate for the most part, I chose not to send it back. My luck on Amazon with just about ANY &#34;lighted&#34; device has been a bust. Getting tired of having to send things back. QC could definitely use some work.
  1097. I am pretty disappointed with the mirror. I purchased the mirror because a lot the reviews mentioned that the light was very bright which was definitely something that I was looking for. But sadly, the light wasn't that bright. There are multiple settings on the mirror that allow one to control the lighting (day, office, evening, home). I exclusively use the home setting because I think it's the brightest setting but even then it's not bright enough. I find myself going back and forth to the mirror in the bathroom which is surprisingly brighter than this mirror. The only reason why I continue to use this mirror is because all my makeup is right next to it and when I turn on all the lights in the room, I find this mirror to be acceptable. The magnification is also not very good although it is acceptable. In addition to the poor lighting, the mirror is way too small. Again, I had to use this mirror in conjunction with my large, well lit bathroom mirror in order to get good make up application. The bottom line is, if you're someone who applies makeup every day and have the money to splurge on something nicer I would.
  1098. I chose this rating because my sweetheart wanted it and when she received the product it had no flaws at all it was shipped with no damages to the box or anything also we received the product an day earlier than expected we satisfied. I will most definely will purchase from these guys again
  1099. Has made me look much better.

I finally caved and realized I had to buy a new one, but Remington doesn't sell them anymore. I researched all the amazon reviews and chose this Jerdon Tri-fold. I love it. It's very bright, it lights up quickly (don't have to hold down the button like some models) and it has 4 light settings. I recommend it for anyone who likes to do their own makeup!

  1126. A great idea -- three different angles to check your face and makeup ... along with various types of lighting. Great in theory but execution is a fail. Unless your dressing table, counter or desk is chest high, this mirror is too low or short to properly see your face and make-up at a decent angle. The support bracket in the back is too flimsy to hold the mirror and its open panels in a stable manner. Too low and you are putting on your makeup looking up your nostrils the whole time. Too high and the mirror wants to fall forward. Too precarious to be useful. It is also not a brightly lit appliance - so the advantage of being able to see your make up in various lighting situations is rather diluted by the room lighting you need to be able to do a good job on your make-up. Would not purchase again. Even with someone else's money.

  1141. First of all, I'm Mrs. Adalis, just using my husbands account to review. I've used this fold-out type of mirror for 30+ years, going through many brands in the process. I prefer the fold-out mirrors over a single middle or round, lit mirror because the side panels allow you to see the sides of your face and inside your ears. Laugh, but everyone in my family uses my mirror to see these areas occasionally, my husband uses it daily to shave and it can be used to see your back (which is how I discovered a suspicious mole years ago). The magnifying mirror is really great for seeing EVERYTHING- sometimes it's scary! This model is the best currently available, but it could be GREATLY improved by changing the hinges from the sides to the top and bottom on the middle panel to allow the middle mirror to swivel left and right. Currently the mirror only swivels top to bottom which doesn't allow you to use the side panels to see in your ears or sides of your face or your back very well. No need for side hinges as height of mirror can easily be adjusted with the arm and groove in the back of mirror. Jerdon, are you listening?

  1145. After much searching and a few disappointments, I am glad I finally found this functional lighted makeup mirror. Jerdon actually created a makeup mirror combination that does exactly what it should do. This mirror combo provides good lighting and two distortion free mirrors in an adjustable design of adequate size at a reasonable price. It is as though this makeup mirror was designed by person who actually applies makeup. The overall size is about 9.75 x 12 inches and fits nicely on my small vanity. The mirrors are about 6 x 7.5 inches, so even the 5x side is big enough to show my face where I apply makeup. I have long hair, so it wold take a large mirror to show my whole head. Now that I wear reading glasses the 5x side is helpful. The fluorescent lamps provide plenty of glare free illumination in the dark corner where my vanity sits. The bulbs remain cool to touch when lighted, which is a definite plus for makeup application. I hope this lasts many years.

  1150. My wife's makeup mirror lost much of the mirroring material.<br /><br />So, she needed a new one.<br /><br />This mirror is similar to the older style type I bought for her as a gift many years ago from Basco.<br /><br />This is a Very large triple makeup mirror with two Bright 9 watt flourescent light tubes.<br /><br />18 Watt Florescent = about 100 Watts incandescent.<br /><br />IMO, Appears to be one of the brightest makeup mirror avalable.<br /><br />I looked at the ConAirs and we almost purchased one of the round styles with the light inside.<br /><br />(but I realized they are not very bright)<br /><br />I carefully read the negative reviews about this product.<br /><br />That is why I had to take a chance and buy this mirror.<br /><br />The reviews that caught my attention were that you need a professional electrical person to replace the bulbs.<br /><br />And the reviewers that mentioned that the bulbs burned out after a few uses.<br /><br />I have some electrical experience with light tubes.<br /><br />My wife told me the bulbs burned out right away.<br /><br />I came in and had to have a quick look.<br /><br />No, The lights are not burned out.<br /><br />The trick is the light is manufactured with the old fashion preheat ballast tubes. (old reliable technology)<br /><br />In order to light the bulbs you must hold the \\"ON\\" switch DOWN for 5 to ten seconds then the lights light and you let go of the switch.<br /><br />The light bulbs are very bright and should work well for years if you do not damage or drop the mirror.<br /><br />My wife complains that she has to hold the \\"ON\\" button down.<br /><br />But, the mirror is indeed extremely bright.<br /><br />Good Luck if you buy this mirror.<br /><br />Hope my tip helps you.

To be honest I didn't like the mirror that much to begin with. I was trying to get use to it after having my old one for so many years. (Which thank goodness I kept because it is back in service). This mirror's setting were very flimsy as on the daylight setting for instance, it was caught between daylight and the next setting giving off a pink glow, which made my face very pink and red. The magnified side was so magnified it was like a fun house mirror in that it was very distorted unless you put your face right on it. I will be trying to get the information to send mine back and get a refund for my parents and possibly a different brand. I do not recommend this mirror as overall I feel it was cheaply made and of course the blow up didn't make my help me see it in a more favorable light.
  1196. The mirror magnification isn't enough for me (my fault for picking the wrong one) however the lights are WAY too dim and pretty much if you sneeze, you knock the swivel mirror out of position. I have to tape it down for it to stay in place. Between that and the fact that I still have to bring in a desk lamp to get enough light, I should've spent the extra money and gotten the more expensive model that a friend has (that I know works).
  1197. This is great! Just like the one my mom had when I was growing up, with four different light settings and a magnification mirror. I liked the adjustable height ramp so I can tilt as needed. Nice and sturdy and brightly lit! And cheaper than buying at Bed Bath and Beyond or Walmart!
  1198. Sorry to say that this mirror stop lighting up completely after just a little over one year. At first the bulbs started flickering, and shortly thereafter the unit would not turn on at all. My previous lighted makeup mirror lasted 34 years, I am not joking. You can imagine my shock and disbelief at this one breaking so soon. I would never purchase any Jerdon brand product again because of their shoddy workmanship. Be forewarned.
  1199. My mother who just turned 100 said she didn't want anything, didn't need anything, and didn't want anyone to buy her anything. But then her 50 year old magnifying mirror broke and I bought this as a replacement. This woman has lived through the century that saw the emergence of the telephone and the motorcar, spaceships to outerspace and then the internet. She still lives on her own and Skypes with me on her laptop! She was actually amazed by this lighted magnifying mirror with 4 different light colors, folding doors so it would take less space on her makeup table (yes she still gets dressed up and puts on \\"her face\\" every day) so this was a great gift.<br /><br />So, though she was excited to receive this mirror it didn't work. The light doesn't really illuminate the face. The mirror is of poor quality and very inaccurate. The stand doesn't stay standing up. I primarily use the magnifying mirror, as it is imperative for fine work like tweezing eyebrows or putting on eye liner. This magnifying mirror is horrible! It is really like a fun house mirror and is actually concave and thus distorts your image unless you move way up close. I have had many magnifying mirrors over the years and NONE have been concave.<br /><br />I find the &#34;wing mirrors&#34; unnecessary and actually get in the way of reaching for my makeup brushes, etc. on the vanity. I am considering seeing if I can remove them.<br /><br />The lighting is fine. I always use the brightest light to apply makeup and the daylight option is fine for that. I do like that the lights are not multiple round bulbs, but are the tubes, which give better light. But the horrible magnifying mirror dictates the three star rating.

This may be fine for doing very close makeup work, but not for anything of any distance, such as styling hair. I don't particulaly like the different color filters for the lights, and I'm just not sure if any accurately duplicate the lighting situations they intend to. The &#34;kickstand&#34; in the back is pretty long, so you can't move the mirror back very far before it hits the wall. A wall-mounting feature might have been nice. When the mirror angle is positioned at its most vertical, it isn't balanced and tends to make the mirror unstable. The magnifying mirror on the flip side is pretty strong, and good if you want to see every pore on your face. Since the lighting doesn't really work for me, I have to give this item to someone else.

We have tried taping, hot gluing, and epoxying brackets onto the back of the mirror to hold the stand on, but nothing sticks to the plastic for long. If you leave the mirror in place, a nice mirror. If you need to move it or put it away after use, then this is not the best mirror for you.

  1320. only had this mirror for about 2 weeks but so far i LOVE IT. i showed it to my husband and he was amazed at all the functions it has. the magnifying mirror is AWESOME. i need to post a pic of my eyebrows so you can see LOL. when i set this up i sat at this mirror doing my eyebrows for probably 30 mins. i do my makeup using this every day. i didnt have trouble turning on the lights like some other reviewers.. it says in the instructions that you have to hold down the ON button instead of just pressing it. the different colors of lights are awesome too. my fave so far is the DAYTIME one. i LOOOOOOOVE how the side mirrors swivel. you can see your whole face that way. it feels like very good quality, not cheap at all. the main reason i got this one as opposed to a conair was you can plug things into it. i have used a curling iron and a flat iron and it works just fine. i will update once i've had this for a little bit longer but so far its great

  1332. Bought the Jerdon Classic JGL9W Lighted Tri-fold Mirror for my daughter for Christmas 2010. It worked well for about a year, and has been spotty since early spring 2012. Now the lights only come on sporadically, and only if you spin the mirror, jump up and down, clap your hands and pray. Then, if we're lucky, the lights MIGHT grace us with their so-called presence. It's so pathetic that Amazon knows that half of these mirrors are defective (I mean, have they actually READ the reviews???) and yet they still sell them. If they wanted to make some money, they could make the lights replaceable and sell the bulbs.<br />Of course, my Amazon warranty was only good for 30 days, and the Jerdon warranty for 1 year, so I'm SOL. Fun stuff.
  1333. I read the reviews prior to purchasing this mirror without caring too much for its lighting or its cheap plastic feel . I needed a tri-fold mirror to trim my side burns all around my ear and possibly back back of my head. I used this mirror so far for 4 days and I will rate it a 1-5 star rating based on:<br /><br />Look and Feel 2 stars<br />The mirror is bulky feels cheaply made as I expected it to be for the price I paid $29.97. It has a built in cord that you CAN'T wrap around it or hide when not in use. You will probably want to hide this mirror when not in use as I did.<br /><br />Mirror Angel options 2 stars<br />The Middle mirror is actually 2 in 1 mirror if you spin it around. The front side has regular mirror and as you spin it vertically, the back part has X5 magnification mirror. The side mirrors, unfortunately are not big enough to cover a full view of your entire face. The reason for this is because they are too close to each other. The whole entire mirror has a tilt lever that allows it to tilt back. The tilt level is not that great because it has a flat long plastic lever that dangles flat like a Popsicle stick when the mirror is not being tilted. The mirror also wobbles on an uneven surface when it is fully erected because there is nothing that will balance support it when it stands straight (Picture it as a hard cover book standing vertically.) It can easily be knocked down with the slightest push. This also knocked the review from 3 stars to 2 stars.<br /><br />Light bulbs and lighting 3 stars<br />It has four lighting effects DAY-OFFICE-EVENING-HOME. They change color as you slide to the desired location It is not a dimmer as I thought it would be. Its actually just a slightly tinted color panel that that slides over the light bulbs to give it a color lighting effect.The bulbs are permanent so you can't replace them once they burn out. I have only been using this mirror for 4 days so I don't know how long the bulbs will last.<br /><br />Overall its not a horrible mirror if want a hands free way to trim the side of your head with side trimmer or hair clipper. By hands free I mean, you don't have to hold a hand-held mirror with one hand to see one side of your face and since you need two hands to trim your sides, one hand to fold the ear down and the other to follow the trim path, a tri-fold mirror like this comes in handy but don't expect anything extra cool features other that the light bulbs and middle-back magnification mirror. It is up to you, the consumer, if $30 is all worth buying it./>Overall its not a horrible mirror if want a hands free way to trim the side of your head with side trimmer or hair clipper. By hands free I mean, you don't have to hold a hand-held mirror with one hand to see one side of your face and since you need two hands to trim your sides, one hand to fold the ear down and the other to follow the trim path, a tri-fold mirror like this comes in handy but don't expect anything extra cool features other that the light bulbs and middle-back magnification mirror. It is up to you, the consumer, if $30 is all worth buying it.

  1370. I bought this mirror 5 months ago after reading many of the positive and negative reviews. Here is my experience on the top 3 issues many people wrote about:<br /><br />1) Lag time turning on - It is like people are describing a totally different product. In the 5 months that I have had this I have not experienced lag time at all. The unit lights up immediately upon turning it on. This has not failed once since I've been using it.<br /><br />2) Bulbs quickly burn out. Again, I have had this mirror for 5 months and it's still going strong. No dimming - no flickering, nothing but reliable use.<br /><br />3) Distorted magnifying mirror. Here's where I would somewhat agree. The mirror does distort when using the magnifier, but it's not so bad that it is unusable. It's just not as good a quality as another magnifier mirror I have. I do use the magnifier mirror regularly especially when tweezing eyebrows and to inspect my skin after facial treatment and it works just fine for those uses.<br /><br />I have absolutely no problem in recommending this mirror. For the price you are getting a product that will do what it is supposed to do and has longevity.

I have to say, the negative reviews people have given about dim or flickering lights really annoy me, because the manufacturers took the time to write in the instructions, and in a special product insert, AND on a sticker placed directly on the mirror that if you experience dim or flickering lights when turn it on the first time, all you need to do is turn the switch off and on rapidly several times to get the lights working properly. They even apologize for the &#34;inconvenience&#34; of asking you to flip a switch a few times, and assure the mirror will work fine after that. How people could miss instructions in THREE separate places and then whine that their mirror doesn't work right is beyond me! But this is a terrific mirror, great size, and I love the various setting for indoor and outdoor lighting types. Great purchase!

  1421. I looked all over for a mirror when mine broke. Finally found this one on Amazon, It is the perfect size and magnification for me. It fits my make up application needs perfectly. It is easy to open and close and also fits on my vanity. It came packed well. It is my second mirror from this company and I have been very satisfied. I also ordered a hanging mirror for my bathroom but it did not have great lighting so I ordered this mirror. It is much better than the brands I have found at local department stores. If you are looking for a well made mirror this is it. I highly recommend. The lighting features are nice being adjustable to the lighting you will be seen in. I usually use the natural lighting as I prefer that then adjust to see how it will look in evening light. That way if I am in brighter light I know how my make up will look. I find the magnification perfect for my needs when applying eyeliner, etc.. Overall this is the perfect mirror. Great price too.

The toggle that changes the lighting options falls off any time I try to move it to the right. The good news is I really only like the day option, so I won't be moving it much (if ever). If I do actually try to change the lighting options, sometimes the different screens that provide the color don't exactly line up the way that they should. Sometimes I have to move the toggle back and forth multiple times before the screens line up properly.<br /><br />Overall, the product is 'meh'. I was looking for a relatively cheap product for my vanity with lighting and would probably be more accepting of its flaws if the price point was lower. I'm not really satisfied by this product, but it will do for now.

I am sure there are many Baby Boomers like me who require the magnification side and I would tell you this mirror is useless now. The quality of the mirror has deteriorated from the 20 years experience I have had with it. Very disappointing. Don't buy it if you think you'll ever need the magnification side.
